MS MCQs

    Configure and work with order fulfillment in Dynamics 365 Commerce

    »

    1. Which of the following selections best describes the types of cost configuration that can be defined in Commerce?

      Shipping cost and other cost

      Simple level cost and tiered level cost

      Simple level cost and other cost

      Shipping cost and tiered level cost


    2. Which of the following options are the components of the profiles that are used by DOM to determine fulfillment recommendations?

      Rules, mode of delivery, retail hierarchy, shipping cost

      Order brokering, order origin, rules, Commerce channels

      Minimum inventory rule, cost configuration, distance to customer

      Rules, mode of delivery, order origin, organization scope, cost factors


    3. Which of the following statements does not apply to the store order fulfillment feature in Commerce?

      Store order fulfillment can be used to help in scenarios of overstock or extra capacity in the brick-and-mortar stores.

      With the appropriate configuration in Commerce Headquarters, the stores might manually accept or reject assigned fulfillment orders.

      A pick-up order in the store must be accepted for fulfillment before the customer can pick it up in the store.

      Notifications in POS can help employees be aware of the orders that need to be fulfilled.
